Posted By: desolation_masticore (12/29/2010 6:40:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My limited friend. I don't know why, but drafting four of these never feels like a bad idea. They're actually tempo that your opponent isn't prepared to deal with most of the time. They're the glue that hold limited decks together, and it's something your opponent isn't going to want to waste removal on. Simply horrid in constructed though, and all in all a really boring uncreative card.  
2/5
posts.html:

Posted By: MasterOfEtherium (4/18/2011 9:34:48 PM)

posts.post_content:
I dunno what everyone's upset about. It's a man driven mad by the vastness of Phyrexia. If he catches you, he'll die to most burn, pale in comparison to most black creatures, and needlessly use up a slot in your opponent's deck. If you're very lucky, he'll do it in that order.  
  
Okay, jokes aside, this is a pretty lousy card. Don't go anywhere near no ruttin' Moriok Reavers.
posts.html:
I dunno what everyone's upset about. It's a man driven mad by the vastness of Phyrexia. If he catches you, he'll die to most burn, pale in comparison to most black creatures, and needlessly use up a slot in your opponent's deck. If you're very lucky, he'll do it in that order.

Okay, jokes aside, this is a pretty lousy card. Don't go anywhere near no ruttin' Moriok Reavers.

Posted By: SpencerDub (10/6/2010 1:35:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not every card can be amazing.  
Vanilla critters are an excruciatingly important part of Magic.  
They form a foundation for all of limited play.  
They help new players to gauge the power level of creatures.  
The lack of rules text allows for much more elaborate flavor text.  
  
There is NOTHING wrong with this card.
posts.html:
Not every card can be amazing.
Vanilla critters are an excruciatingly important part of Magic.
They form a foundation for all of limited play.
They help new players to gauge the power level of creatures.
The lack of rules text allows for much more elaborate flavor text.

There is NOTHING wrong with this card.
